definition: Pressure is defined as the force applied per unit area perpendicular to the surface.

steps: Pressure (P) is defined as the force (F) acting per unit area (A) perpendicular to the surface.
Mathematically, this is expressed as P = F / A.
Where F is the thrust applied perpendicular to the surface, and A is the surface area.
Substitute values into the formula: P = F / A

definition: Work is defined as the product of force and displacement in the direction of the force.

steps: Work (W) is defined as the force (F) applied on an object multiplied by the displacement (d) it causes in the direction of the force.
When there is an angle θ between the force and displacement, only the component of force in the direction of displacement does work.
Substitute values into the formula: W = F × d × cosθ

definition: Kinetic energy is the energy possessed by an object due to its motion.

steps: Work done on an object is converted to its kinetic energy.
Work done W = F × d = ma × d (from Newton's second law).
Using v² = u² + 2ad and assuming u = 0, d = v² / (2a).
Substitute d into W: W = m × a × v² / (2a) = 1/2 × m × v².
Substitute values into the formula: KE = 1/2 × m × v²

definition: Gravitational potential energy is the energy possessed by an object due to its position in a gravitational field.

steps: Potential energy is defined as the work done to raise an object to a height h.
Here, force = m × g (weight of the object), and displacement = h.
Thus, U = W = m × g × h.
Substitute values into the formula: U = m × g × h

definition: Ohm's Law states that the current through a conductor is directly proportional to the potential difference across it, provided the temperature remains constant.

steps: Ohm's Law is an experimental observation.
It states that the ratio of the voltage (V) across a conductor to the current (I) through it is a constant, called resistance (R).
Substitute values into the formula: V = I × R
